text:
SICU
   HPI:
   HPI: 69 with h/o gastric PUD s/p antrectomy/Billroth II and then later
   Roux-en-Y conversion for reflux problems. [**12-28**] obstructive jaundice
   and cholangitis and percutaneous transhepatic cholangio tube was
   placed. On imaging there was a mass at the end of the bile duct. ERCP
   showed a cut-off stricture at the ampullary level and MRCP demonstrated
   a mass-like effectin the duodenum at that point. Pt subsequently
   underwent whipple, chole, enteroenterostomy x2 on
   [**2173-1-20**]. Biopsy revealed adenocarcinoma of dudodenum at the ampulla.
   Post-operative course complicated by anastamotic breakdowns of the
   hepatojejunostomy and pancreaticojejunostomy sites, requiring OR [**2-5**]
   for drainage of an intra-abdominal abscess, repair of
   pancreaticojejunostomy and subsequent re-drainage and suturing of
   intestinal perforations. He has also had IR drainage and drain
   placement into a blind ending loop of bowel leaking into an abdominal
   abscess cavity on [**2-12**].
   He also had brief dyspnea and persistent hypoxia post-operatively, with
   evaluation showing tracheobronchomalacia with bile seen in the trachea.
   He has had persistent low-grade fevers on broad spectrum antibiotics.
   [**2-20**] he developed a rash in the context of multiple antibiotics for
   persistent fevers.  He had eosinophilia of 12% and a slow drop off in
   renal function over the past few weeks. In this setting pt developed
   rash c/w reaction to zosyn. His renal function worsened, mental status
   declined in the setting of uremia, pt became hypotensive and
   subsequently was transferred to SICU after undergoing hemodialysis.
   PMH: HTN, ARF ([**2-22**] infectious process),gastric peptic ulcer disease,
   Adenocarcinoma of the duodenum, Tracheobronchomalacia, should receive
   Fyb-antigen negative products for all red cell transfusions (antibody
   may cause hemolytic transfusion reactions)
   PSH:
   -antrectomy, Billroth II        -Roux-en-Y conversion for reflux
   problems
   [**Name (NI) **] continues with mild dyspnea today.  On 60% Face tent.  RR
   30-40.  O2 sat has been between 96-98% consistently.  No signs of
   hypoxia evident.
   Renal failure, acute (Acute renal failure, ARF)
   Assessment:
   Continues with renal failure.  BUN/Creat remain elevated. (72/7.9).
   Urine output is labile (15-100 cc
s/hr/)
   Action:
   HD today.  40 mg Lasix given today as well
   Response:
   Tolerated HD well, 2L removed.  1 unit RBC
s given.
   Plan:
   Transfer to the floor.  Continue with HD as ordered.
